search.title: Field-Specific Search
search.description: You can search for specific fields using two different operators: colon (:) for partial matches and equals (=) for exact matches.

examples.title: Field Examples
examples.songField: Use 'song:Ex' for partial match or 'song=Example' for exact match
examples.artistField: Use 'artist:Art' for partial match or 'artist=Artist' for exact match
examples.charterField: Use 'charter:Char' for partial match or 'charter=Charter' for exact match

operators.title: Search Operators
operators.description: You can combine multiple search conditions using operators.

examples.title: Operator Examples
examples.and: Search for levels that match both conditions (AND)
examples.or: Search for levels that match either condition (OR)
examples.complex: Complex search combining AND and OR conditions

points.caseSensitive: Searches are case-insensitive - 'SONG' and 'song' will give the same results
points.partial: Colon (:) allows partial matches - 'song:Ex' will match 'Example'
points.exact: Equals (=) requires exact matches - 'song=Example' will only match 'Example'
points.spaces: Spaces are allowed in search terms - 'song:Example Song' works
points.order: The order of conditions doesn't matter within each group
